support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: “Dhātunānattaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ, phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, diversity of elements gives rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings.
And what is the diversity of elements?
The eye element, ear element, nose element, tongue element, body element, and mind element.
This is called the diversity of elements.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ, phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattaṃ?
segments.en: And how does diversity of elements give rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings?

segments.pli: Cakkhudhātuṃ, bhikkhave, paṭicca uppajjati cakkhusamphasso, cakkhusamphassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati cakkhusamphassajā vedanā … pe …
segments.en: The eye element gives rise to eye contact. Eye contact gives rise to the feeling born of eye contact. …

segments.pli: manodhātuṃ paṭicca uppajjati manosamphasso, manosamphassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati manosamphassajā vedanā.
segments.en: The mind element gives rise to mind contact. Mind contact gives rise to the feeling born of mind contact.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ, phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan”ti.
segments.en: That’s how diversity of elements gives rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings.”

suttaplex.blurb: Diverse contacts give rise to diverse feelings.
